alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 11:21AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Harrison, central Clark, Floyd and north central Meade Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1119 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Albany, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jeffersonville around 1130 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
